dt.t: She's one of the team's best {wi}players{/wi}.

dt: {bc}a person who plays a musical instrument

dt.t: … what drew these audiences was the emergence of the movie star from the ranks of the wholly anonymous {wi}players{/wi} of a decade earlier.

dt: {bc}a device that reproduces recorded material (such as video images or music) from a usually specified medium
{bc}one actively involved especially in a competitive field or process {bc}{sx|participant||}
{bc}a person and especially a man who has many lovers

dt.t: Handsome and a well-paid professional, Keith, 35, chose to be a {wi}player{/wi}, juggling a series of relatively brief and sometimes over-lapping intimate relationships with women.
This album has a lot of sexual references. It's almost like Bobby's … a {wi}playa{/wi}.

dt: The variant {it}playa{/it} is more common in transcribed speech.

shortdef: a person who plays a game
a person who plays a musical instrument
